item.title: Lark add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Lark add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "Listen to the mustn'ts, child. Listen to the don'ts. Listen to the shouldn'ts, the impossibles, the won'ts. Listen to the never haves, then listen close to me... Anything can happen, child. Anything can be." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Lark add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Lark add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Political language is designed to make lies sound truthful and murder respectable, and to give an appearance of solidity to pure wind. " -- George Orwell

item.title: Lark add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "I think and think and think, I‘ve thought myself out of happiness one million times, but never once into it." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Lark add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "Whether we're talking about fish species, pigs, or some other eaten animal, is such suffering the most important thing in the world? Obviously not. But that's not the question. Is it more important that sushi, bacon, or chicken nuggets? That's the question." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Lark add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "The word Fascism has now no meaning except in so far as it signifies "something not desirable"...In the case of a word like democracy, not only is there no agreed definition, but the attempt to make one is resisted from all sides. It is almost universally felt that when we call a country democratic we are praising it: consequently the defenders of every kind of regime claim that it is a democracy, and fear that they might have to stop using the word if it were tied down to any one meaning." -- George Orwell

item.title: Lark add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "...it is not the big events that hurt the most but rather the smallest questionable shift in tone at the end of a spoken word that can plow most deeply into the heart." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Lark add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "Some nights, alone, he thinks of her, and some nights, alone, she thinks of him. Some night these thoughts, separated by miles and time zones, occur at the same objective moment, and Ray and Mirabelle are connected without ever knowing it." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Lark add a quote by Primo Levi
item.description: "Voi che vivete sicuri Nelle vostre tiepide case oi che trovate tornando a sera Il cibo caldo e visi amici Considerati si questo è un uomo Che lavora nel gango Che non conosce pace Che lotta por mezzo pane Che muore per un sì o per un no Considerate se questa é una donna Senza caplli e senza nome Senza più forza di ricordare Vuoti gli occhi e freddo il grembo Come una rana d'inverno Meditate che questo è stato Vi comando queste parole Scolpitele nem vuostro cuore Stando in casa andando per via Coricandovi alzandovi Ripetelete ai vostri figli O vi si sfaccia la casa La malattia vi impedisca I vostri nati torcano il viso da voi." -- Primo Levi

item.title: Lark add a quote by Primo Levi
item.description: "I too entered the Lager as a nonbeliever, and as a nonbeliever I was liberated and have lived to this day." -- Primo Levi
